6.2.2	
Treatment of intermediate-risk disease
When managed with non-curative intent, intermediate-risk PCa is associated with 10-year and 15-year PCSM 
rates of 13.0% and 19.6%, respectively [841]. These estimates are based on systematic biopsies and may be 
overestimated in the era of MRI-targeted biopsies.

Manage patients with a life expectancy < 10 years by watchful waiting. 
Strong

Manage patients with a life expectancy > 10 years and low-risk disease by AS.
Strong
Patients with intraductal histology on biopsy should be excluded from AS.

Perform magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) before a confirmatory biopsy if no MRI has been 
performed before the initial biopsy.

Take both targeted biopsy (of any PI-RADS > 3 lesion) and systematic biopsy if a 
confirmatory biopsy is performed.
If MRI is not available, per-protocol confirmatory prostate biopsies should be performed.

If a patient has had upfront MRI followed by systematic and targeted biopsies there is no 
need for confirmatory biopsies.

Repeat biopsies should be performed at least once every 3 years for 10 years.
